actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation

official_title: A bill to amend title 23, United States Code with respect to the Richmond-Petersburg Turnpike, and U.S. Interstate 66.

summary.text: Declares the Richmond-Petersburg Turnpike free of restrictions on the imposition of tolls upon the repayment by the Commonwealth of Virginia of certain Federal-aid highway funds relating to such Turnpike. Directs the Secretary of Transportation to conduct a demonstration project for a period of 12 months on Interstate Highway 66, in Virginia, which restricts the use of such highway to high occupancy vehicles (three or more occupants, not four or more, as now) during the morning and evening rush hours. Exempts vehicles which enter the highway at specified points from such restriction. Directs the Secretary to carry out an environmental assessment of such restrictions and report to Congress on the results of the assessment and demonstration project.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 23, United States Code with respect to the Richmond-Petersburg Turnpike, and U.S. Interstate 66.
